definition: handsome/refined/elegant/graceful/superior/show (loanword)/CL:場|场[chang2]/(literary) to grow/to bloom/(of crops) to produce ears
Yuexiu district of Guangzhou city 廣州市|广州市[Guang3 zhou1 shi4], Guangdong
lit. only one branch of the tree is thriving (idiom)/fig. to be in a league of one's own/outstanding
a person who has passed the county level imperial exam (historical)/scholar/skillful writer/fine talent
an up-and-coming youngster/new talent/a brilliant younger generation
Xiushan Tujia and Miao Autonomous County in Chongqing
Chen Duxiu (1879-1942), co-founder of the Chinese Communist Party in 1921
lit. verdant hills and limpid water (idiom)/fig. enchanting scenery
to surpass/to stand above the crowd
girl from a wealthy family/unmarried daughter of a noble house

sentences.english: People will pay for access to those in a way they won't for the latest episode of House or a reality show.
sentences.chinese: 人们付费来阅览的并非是一段议会的插曲或现实秀。

sentences.english: With the formal suits but humorous gestures, the Chorale made their first appearance.
sentences.chinese: 正式的着装，诙谐的动作，是该合唱团的出场秀。

sentences.english: Watch this ticker on your desktop or put it on your website or MySpace .
sentences.chinese: 最新的功能是可把幻灯秀崁在自己的电脑桌面。

sentences.english: And that many jump from the bridge to denounce firewood is really a" show"?
sentences.chinese: 而那许多的跳桥讨薪真的是一场“秀”吗？

sentences.english: Shoes also have the power to make an entire show go awry.
sentences.chinese: 鞋子也有把整台秀搞砸的能力。

sentences.english: Animals also injured and killed in other rodeo events.
sentences.chinese: 在其他的竞技秀项目中，动物也会受伤或死去。

sentences.english: "The Internet is the modern-day freak show, " says Szymanski.
sentences.chinese: “网络就是现代的反常秀，”斯泽曼斯基说。

sentences.english: And the Antiques Roadshow has paid dividends to small dealers as well.
sentences.chinese: 和古董巡回秀已给小的经销商带来好处。

sentences.english: Eppie Bang is a Senior Financial Analyst at The Nature Conservancy, Florida Chapter.
sentences.chinese: 莫慧秀覝任职大自然保护协会佛州分部高级财务分析。

sentences.english: She is also a co-host of The Fashion Show.
sentences.chinese: 她也是一家时尚秀的合作主持人。

sentences.english: What do you think of her runway look?
sentences.chinese: 你认为她在秀台上看起来如何？

sentences.english: Anyway, do you dare to “wear” like them and walking on the street?
sentences.chinese: 不管怎样，你敢“穿”得像他们一样在街头秀一下吗？

sentences.english: Sure, then you should get a miniskirt so you can really show it off.
sentences.chinese: 当然，然后你应该穿上超短裙去街上秀给别人看。

sentences.english: Turn the lights down low, take it off, let me show.
sentences.chinese: 调暗灯光，撩开面纱，我为你秀。

sentences.english: Instead, Orlando Magic first-round draft pick Daniel Orton has learned patience.
sentences.chinese: 然而奥兰多魔术首轮秀丹尼尔奥尔顿得先学会耐心。

sentences.english: Were they just a runner-up in the game show "Happily Ever After"?
sentences.chinese: 他们只是游戏秀“从此幸福”里面的亚军吗？

definition: a fashion show/to walk the runway (in a fashion show)
to dazzle/to boast/to show off/(slang) cool/awesome
Yingge or Yingko town in New Taipei City 新北市[Xin1 bei3 shi4], Taiwan

to scale (a height)/to ascend/to mount/to publish or record/to enter (e.g. in a register)/to press down with the foot/to step or tread on/to put on (shoes or trousers) (dialect)/to be gathered and taken to the threshing ground (old)
to go on stage/fig. to appear on the scene/used in advertising to mean new product
to screen (a movie)/to stage (a play)/a screening/a staging
second round (of a match or election)
